# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here's a simple Julia function that does what you described:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), ' ' => "_", '-' => "_")
end
```
This function first strips the leading and trailing white spaces from `col`, then it converts all characters to lower case. Then it replaces any space or hyphen with an underscore, effectively cleaning the column name according to your specifications.
